tweets.text: Yesterday, I joined @TheLastWord to discuss a number of topics, including the Connecticut Supreme Court’s groundbreaking decision to allow the families of the #SandyHook victims to sue gun manufacturer Remington Arms. This is one step closer to justice. https://t.co/RAkVuVJbe4
(“Thoughts and prayers” is reference to the NRA’s phrase used to deflect conversation away from policy change during tragedies. Not directed to PM Ardern, who I greatly admire.)

Jane & I are heartbroken for the families and loved ones of the victims who lost their lives in the senseless mosque attacks in New Zealand. We stand with New Zealand in condemning these terrorist attacks and pray for a swift recovery for those wounded.

Regardless, 49 people have died in yet another mass shooting. It’s sad that these things are becoming desensitizing. It’s hard to be shocked anymore, simply because of how constant they seem to be. If it isn’t obvious, something needs to be done, and soon.
